direction.raw_text: connected together with LEG IRONS, being run, by TWO: WHITE MALE HILLBILLIES on HORSEBACK. The location is somewhere in Texas. The Black Men (ROY, BIG SID, BENJAMIN, DJANGO, PUDGY RALPH, FRANKLYN, and BLUEBERRY) are slaves just recently purchased at The Greenville Slave Auction in Greenville Mississippi. The White Hillbillies are two Slave Traders called, The SPECK BROTHERS (ACE and DICKY). One of the seven slaves is our hero DJANGO... . he's fourth in the leg iron line. We may or may not notice a tiny small "r" burned into his cheek ("r" for runaway), but we can't help but notice his back which has been SLASHED TO RIBBONS by Bull Whip Beatings. As the Operatic Opening Theme Song plays, we see a MONTAGE of misery and pain, as Django and the Other Men are walked through blistering sun, pounding rain, and moved along by the end of a whip. Bare feet step on hard rock, and slosh through mud puddles. Leg Irons take the skin off ankles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The CREDITS play, DJANGO has a SPAGHETTI WESTERN FLASHBACK. Now Spaghetti Western Flashbacks are never pretty, it's usually the time in the film when the lead character thinks back to the most painful memory inflicted on him or his loved ones from evil characters from his past. In this instance we see Django in a SLAVE PEN at the Greenville Auction.

direction.raw_text: It's night time and The Speck Brothers, astride HORSES, keep pushing their black skinned cargo forward. It's a very pitch black night, with only a few stars in the.sky to create a little top light. It's so dark, the Slavers use the creek.bed to keep from getting lost. Both Speck Brothers carry a lantern up on their horse, as. does Roy, the Slave in lead position on the chain gang. It's also a bitterly cold night, with the breath of the seven slaves, two slavers, and two horses creating clouds in the air. In fact the seven chained together Slaves, with the lead one holding a lantern, and all of them chugging out smoky breath, and. slightly moving in unison, resemble a human locomotive. The Slaves shiver from the cold on their shirtless backs, both Speck Brothers wear rawhide winter coats with white fur linings, and white fur collars.

Dr.SCHULTZ And since your late brother. won't be using it anymore, I'd like to purchase his nag. He removes a twenty dollar gold piece from his. pocket, and tosses it on Dicky's body. He bends down and, puts the paper money-.in the saddle bags on Dicky's dead horse. With.his hands in there, he roots around and finds the keys to-the leg irons. He unlocks Django's leg irons. In other words, from his perspective, and memory. This is the,only time the story will shift to Broomhilda's perspective. The strong but frightened girl is led out on to the hustle and bustle, and wagon wheels and horse hoofs of Main Street. Broomhilda is not taken into that three story auction arena that Django was sold in at the beginning. Instead She's just lifted up on a parked buckboard wagon. The Caravan enters the road that leads to the front of the Plantation, or The Big House as everyone calls it. To the left of the Big House is big wooden ARENA built for his Friday night nigger fights. All the HOUSE SLAVES (the domestic slaves that work for the Candie family in the Big House), and WHITE WORKERS (overseers and stray farm hands) come out to greet the caravan. They all greet Monsieur Calvin Candie, who naturally leads the procession, as if he's Alexander The Great returning from the wars. As the caravan comes to a stop in front of the Big House, it creates a huge dust cloud behind it. Calvin's widowed sister LARA LEE CANDIE-FITZWILLY, an attractive i12. fortyish, strawberry blonde southern belle, steps out on the porch of the Big House to greet her brother. Directly above Lara Lee, on the third floor balcony over hang, out. steps...

direction.raw_text: eyeing Calvin and the approaching caravan. Who's STEPHEN? Stephen is a very old black man, who with his bald pate, and tufts of white curly hair on the sides, looks like a character out of Dickens - if Dickens wrote about House Niggers in the Antebellum South. - Stephen has been Calvin's slave since he was a little boy. And in (almost) every way is the 2nd most powerful person at Candyland. Like the characters Basil Rathbone would play in swashbucklers, evil, scheming, intriguing men, always trying to influence and manipulate power for their own self interest. Well that describes Stephen to a tee. The Basil Rathbone of House Niggers. The old Man watches the caravan and the trailing dust cloud approach.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Snowball. : Stephen looks up at Django on Tony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you wanna know who I am, or the name of my horse, you ask me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just'who the hell you callin' Snowball, horse boy? I'll yank your ass of that goddamn'nag, so goddamn fast - in the mud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, Stephen, let's keep it funny. Django's a Freeman. Stephen jerks a thumb up towards Django.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This nigger, here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That nigger there. Let me at least introduce the two of. you. Django, this is another cheeky black bugger like yourself, Stephen. Stephen, this is Django. You two should hate each other. Stephen uses'the special privilege he and he alone enjoys amongst the blacks at Candyland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin, who the hell is this nigger you feel the need to entertain?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Django and his friend in grey, Dr.Schultz are customers, and they are our guests Stephen. And you - you old decrepit bastard... .are to show them every hospitality. Do you understand that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why I gotta -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't hafta know why, do you understand?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah yeah yeah, I understand just fine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good. They're spending the night. Go up in the guest bedrooms and get two ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gonna stay in the Big House?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen, he's a slaver. It's different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the Big House?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You gotta problem with that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't gotta problem, unless you gotta problem with burin' the bed, the sheets, and the pillow cases once this black ass motherfuckers gone!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my problem, they're mine to burn. Your problem, right now, is making a good impression. And I want you to start solving that problem right now, and git them rooms ready. The Old Man looks up at his Master, and says;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir, Monsieur Candie. Stephen limps away to the guest rooms, muttering to'himself. Lara Lee and her ever present shadow, a FAT MAMMY named CORA, comes up to her brother on his horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr.Schultz, this attractive southern belle is my widowed sister, may I present to you, Lara Lee Candie-Fitzwilly. Lara Lee does a southern lady bow. Dr.Schultz lifts his bowler hat, and nods in a grand manner. Dr.SCHULTZ I am Dr.King Schultz, this is my 2nd Django, (Django tips his hat) and these are our horses, Fritz and Tony. Both Fritz and Tony do the head bow. Dr.SCHULTZ And it is our great delight to encounter this flaming rose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well aren't you the charming gentlemen. You're not from around here, are you? Dr.SCHULTZ Actually I'm from a far off land, Dusseldorf, to be exact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These two are in the market for a fightin' nigger. So I thought I'd invite 'em down, show 'em my stock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll all have dinner tonight, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Half the reason I invited them. I thought you'd find.them as intriguing as I do little sister. Lara Lee looks up at Django, and smiles. All of a sudden THREE WHITE RIDERS ride up on horses, a older one, and two tough looking younger ones. The'older one is the Cap't of the Overseers, ACE WOODY, and his two assistants BROWN and JINGLE BELLS CODY. While Ace is dressed for work on a farm, both Brown and Jingle Bells Cody are peacocks who wear cool cowboy outfits. As Calvin Candie watches the three riders approach, he turns to Dr.Schultz and Django, and says;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know since I started fightin' niggers about eleven years ago, it's been a new lease on'life. And the man ridin' up here now is the man responsible for all my success. Ace and his boys pull their horses up, kicking up dust. Through the dust Ace, Brown, and Jingle Bells Cody eyeball Django and Schultz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Howdy Ace. (TO SCHULTZ AND DJANGO) This here is my Overseer .Cap't, and nigger fight trainer extraordinaire, Ace Woody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pointing at the two shadows that flank Ace Woody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And that's Brown and that's Jingle Bells Cody. (TO ACE) Ace, this here is Dr.Ring Schultz, and Django Freeman, they're big customers with big pockets wanna buy a big nigger. So I brought 'em out here so you could give 'em a little display of our African flesh. Ace takes off his hat, bows from his horse, welcoming them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Welcome to Candyland, gentlemen. Astride their horses Brown and Jingle Bells Cody just make faces at Django. Ace's attention goes to the five new mandingos.just walked from Greenville to here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These the new chickens?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes siree bob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many you get? (HE COUNTS) One, two, three, four, five.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five real strong bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How many you get rid of?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We still got three left. Ace looks to see who came back from the auction. Leo Moguy chimes in;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I already wired the LeQuint Dickey people, they'll be here tomorrow. Ace turns to Brown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get 'em away from the others. Put 'em in the pen till tomorrow. Brown with his horse, yells, chases, and herds the three men away into the slave pen. Ace yells from his horse down to the five new mandingo arrivals, Big Fred, Banjo, Sidney James, Tatum,.and Joshua.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'all stand over there and make a line! They do. Ace climbs down from off his horse. Cody stays in his saddle, circling the black men with his horse. Everybody, including Django and Dr.Schultz, watch the show. Ace'Woody walks up and down the line looking at the new men. Candie, sitting comfortably up on his horse, says;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you lookin' for niggers to push a plow, 'dem your boys. Candie rolls his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong with them?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it...hold it, you done bought r em, let me look at 'em. Unimpressed Ace Woody continues to examine them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, how 'bout that one, did you buy that one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Which one?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you mean, which one? The one I'm pointing at, that one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, that one was purchased by our mister Moguy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You bought him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like his prospects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His prospects? Now you know Mr..Moguy, I ain't a educated fella like yourself. Remind me again what prospects means?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hope for the future. Jerking a thumb towards the slave in question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got hope for his future?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I don't. Ace walks over to the slave in question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your name, boy? The mandingo says;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sidney James, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So long Sidney James. Ace takes the peacemaker out of the holster on his hip, and SHOOTS Sidney James point blank in the belly. Everybody reacts. Especially the four other mandingos standing next to him. Sidney James rolls in the dirt, screaming and holding his bleeding gut. Till Cody puts a bullet in his head, putting him out of his misery. Moguy, shakes his head, "Typical," he thinks. Django and Schultz, on their horses next. to Candid, watch. Ace looks up at his boss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Boss Candie, which one did you buy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well to me the pick of the litter is Big Fred over there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one over here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You Fred? A very scared Fred answers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well good to meet'cha Fred, I'm'Ace Woody, I'm a man of influence 'round here. Now Fred am I mistaken, or were you already in a kurfuffle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had 'em fight one of Amerigo's niggers last night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How is of Amerigo?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His nigger lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? You won?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wup'ed his ass?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beat 'em to death. Smiling impressively at Big Fred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He did have fifteen pounds on 'em, but still, he still beat his ass to death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good job, boy. Got any more wins in ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. Ace gives Cody a slight head nod, and Cody SHOOTS Big Fred in the back. Candie acts out mock frustration. The remaining three mandingos jump a mile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now why did you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won his last fight last night. Ace puts his eyes on the three remaining mandingos
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those of you with exceptional ability will find it ain't so bad here. Those of you who don't possess exceptional ability, will wish you did. Ace looks up to Cody on his horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Run 'em over to the Arena. Git 'em doin push ups. First one gives out, shoot 'em in the head. (TO MANDINGOS) Welcome to Candyland, boys! Cody runs the terrified mandingos to the arena. Candie leans over to Schultz and says;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We only get about two out of every batch of five fighters we buy. But those two tend to be lucky. Ace Woody hops back up on his horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Mr.Woody, I'm beginning to think that you don't trust my judgement? Ace Woody just smiles at his boss, and says;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh you know I always trust your judgement, Boss Candie...eventually. He rides off. Stephen limps back to the action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ahhh, Stephen my boy, rooms ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All ready for your guest and his nigger. Candie'shakes his head in mock frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen, you're incorrigible. (TO SCHULTZ AND DJANGO) Gentlemen, let Stephen show you to your rooms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you can lie down and rest up for a couple of hours. Then we'll have some lemonade, and I'll show off some of my finer specimens. Dr.SCHULTZ Splendid. Both Dr.Schultz and Django climb down from their horses. Candie looks to a black little stable boy of about eight named TIMMY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Timmy boy, go take their horses for 'em. Fix 'em up at the stable, give 'em a load of oats. Django hands the boy the reigns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Fritz, this is Tony. You take good care of 'em now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. Django takes an apple out of his saddle bag, and hands it to the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once he's in the stable, give 'em that. He reaches back in the saddle and pulls out another one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give that one to Fritz. Timmy leads the horses away. The two visitors start to follow Stephen to their rooms, when Dr.Schultz pretends to remember something; Dr.SCHULTZ Oh, Monsieur Candie, about that matter about the nigger girl we were talking about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nigger girl? Dr.SCHULTZ I believe you said she spoke German?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Yes, Hildi, what about her? ,oz. Dr.SCHULTZ Do you think before the demonstration you could send her around to my room?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't see why not. (TO STEPHEN) Stephen, when you get through showing them to their rooms, go fetch Hildi. I want her cleaned up and smellin' nice, and sent over to Dr.Schultz's room. Stephen has to be the bearer of bad news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually... . Monsieur Candie... . there's somethin' we ain't tole you yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildi's in The Hot Box. This gets Django's, Schultz's, and Candie's attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's she doin' there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What 'cha think she doin' in The Hot Box, she bein punished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What she do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She ran away again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ, how many people ran away when I was gone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When did she go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last night. They brought her back this morning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How bad did Stonesipher's dogs tear her up? Django's hand falls to the butt of his smoke wagon. If they sicked those dogs on his angel, he's going to just kill all these motherfuckers right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucky for her they were busy lookin' for D'Artagnan's ass. Brown and Cody went out lookin' for her and found her. She a little beat up, but she did that to herself. Runnin' through them damn bushes. Django's hand moves away from his gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How long she been in the box?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What'cha think, all goddamn day! Little fool got ten more days to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take her out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take her out? Why!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I said so, that's why. Hildi is my nigger. Dr.Schultz is my guest. Southern hospitality dictates I make her available to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Monsieur Candie, she just ran away?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus Christ Stephen, what's the point of havin' a nigger speaks German if-you can't wheel 'em out when you have a German guest? I realize it's inconvenient. Still, take her out. (to Cora and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lara Lee would you and Cora be responsible for getting her cleaned up and presentable for Dr.Schultz? The overseers,'Tommy Giles and Hoot Peters go to The Hot.Box. While Billy Crash goes to the well to draw a bucket of water. Django watches them walk to The Hot Box. Dr.Schultz's eyes shift to Django, to watch him watch this. Stephen notices Django's interest in both The Hot Box and whoever's sizzling in it. The HOT BOX itself is a large IRON SOLITARY CONFINEMENT CELL DOOR (from Yuma Prison) built into the ground. They put a key in the lock, and the two men lift the heavy iron door open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A naked Broomhilda broiling in a small coffin like iron box dug into the ground. Broomhilda reacts to the sudden burst of blinding sunshine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Billy Crash TOSSES the bucket of water on her. Django watches this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: :.From his wide shot perspective we see them yank the NAKED BROOMHILDA (incoherent) out of the hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as we move into a Sergio Leone CU of DJANGO'S FACE. Stephen breaks the mood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You comin', or you wanna sleep in that little box? Django turns his back on the naked Broomhilda and follows Stephen and Dr.Schultz up the front steps of The Big House.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE BIG HOUSE - DAY Stephen leads the two guests up the big prominent sweeping staircase in the entry way of The Big House. Then down the hallway with the guest rooms. Dr.Schultz is shown his guest room by Stephen. Schultz enters the room and shuts the door behind him. Stephen takes Django to the room next door, opens the door, and leads him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DJANGO'S GUEST ROOM - DAY A guest room with a big feather bed, dresser drawer with a flowery pitcher of water and basin on top of it. A little bedside table with a lamp and a tiny bell on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one's yours, boy. That bed's damn nice too. Django walks over to the window, parts the curtains and peers out. Broomhilda's gone. As he looks through the glass, snotty Stephen rattles on in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Feel free to touch anything you want, cause we burnin' all this shit once you gone. I'll have somebody knock on the door when the demonstration ready. Django sits down on the bed. Stephen turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not so fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got more important things to do then jaw with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nigger, when I say stop you plant roots. Both the words and the tone stop Stephen dead. He turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This tiny bell on this little table... .is this for you? I ring this, you do fer me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me or somebody. Django reaches over and picks up the bell. (a soft) DING-A-LING STEPHEN (UNAMUSED) What 'cha want?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to pour some water in that bowl for my wash up. Stephen does what he's told, but with attitude. )O' Django shuts the guest room door so the two men are alone. Once Stephen's done, Django stands up from the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimmie. Stephen hands him the basin full of water. Django takes it from him. Then throws the water in Stephen's face. The dripping wet old slave can do nothing against this free man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatsamatter Stephen, you don't like that? Django takes his hand and SLAPS the old man hard across the face knocking him to the floor;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my kinda bell ringin'. Git up. The old man timidly, slowly, and shaky rises off the floor - as soon as he does - Django SLAPS HIM TO THE FLOOR again. Then Django sits back down on the bed, looking at the old man on the floor below his knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've known me House Niggers like you my whole life. Play your dog tricks with your Massa'. Ya' lip off to him every now an' then, as long as ya' keep it funny. He rolls his eyes and puts up with it, and all the white folks think it's so cute. Meanwhile you got all these niggas round here hoppin' and jumpin' to stay on your good side. Well this time Snowball, you gonna listen to me. You got anymore sass you wanna sling my way, before they give us a mandingo demonstration, I'm gonna give this whole motherfuckin plantation a demonstration, of ME beatin' the BLACK off your ass. I will make you drop your drawers, I'll take off my belt, and I will Wup' your bare ass with it, in front of every nigga on this plantation. And after I do that, let's see you play the rooster round here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin wouldn't. let you do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh that's right, he gives you first name privileges... . ain't that cute. Sass me me again nigger, see what happen'. Stephen lying on the floor, bites his tongue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I thought. Now git outta"here. With as much dignity as he can muster, Stephen stands up. Before he leaves, Django tells him;,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When I ring this bell, you better come a runnin'. You - not nobody else. While I'm on this property, you my nigger Snowball. Stephen leaves. Django lies down on the bed. He covers his eyes with his arm. A door joins Django and Schultz's room. The adjoining door opens, and Schultz stands there. Dr.SCHULTZ Was that wise? Django doesn't remove his arm from.his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ain't tellin' nobody 'bout that. That's all that needs to be said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - HALLWAY (BIG HOUSE) - DAY Lara Lee, Cora, and a traumatized, but cleaned up (she's dressed in a domestic maid uniform) Broomhilda stand outside Dr.Schultz's door, after Calvin's sister raps on it. Dr.Schultz opens the door. Dr.SCHULTZ Hello ladies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr.Schultz, may I introduce to you, Hildi. Hildi, this is Dr.Schultz, he speaks German. Dr.SCHULTZ (TO BROOMHILDA) I've been informed you do as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It would be my, pleasure to speak with you in German. Schultz acts for the benefit of Miss Lara's astonishment. Dr.SCHULTZ Astonishing. (IN GERMAN) Please come inside Fraulein. She does, and just'as Lara Lee is to say something, Schultz says, "Thank You very much," and closes the door in her face. Miss Lara looks to her Mammy, and the two women head off nonplussed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - SCHULTZ'S GUEST ROOM (BIG HOUSE) - LATE AFTERNOON With the door closed, Schultz turns to the weak, frightened, disoriented girl. He gives her a pleasant smile. Dr.SCHULTZ They call you Hildi, but your real name is Broomhilda, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. How do you know that? Dr.SCHULTZ Stands to reason who ever taught you German would also give you a German name. Can I pour you a glass of water, Broomhilda? Hearing her name being spoke properly for the first time in awhile, not to mention with a German accent, does have a bit of a calming influence on the frightened girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on the other side of the adjoining door, listening, waiting for his cue to present himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr.SCHULTZ As Dr.Schultz calmly pours the young lady a glass of water, he begins talking to her in GERMAN SUBTITLED IN ENGLISH; Dr.SCHULTZ (GERMAN) I'm aware you haven't spoken German in a long while. So I'll talk slowly. I'm only speaking German to you now, Broomhilda, in case Candie's people are listening to us. Myself and a mutual friend of ours, have gone through a lot of trouble, and rode a lot of miles, to find you fraulein - to rescue you. He hands her a tall clear glass of water. She looks at him weird, rescue me? Dr.SCHULTZ (GERMAN) Please drink. She absentmindedly obeys. Dr.SCHULTZ (.GERMAN). Now it's myself and our mutual friend's intention to take you away from here forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't got any friends. Dr.SCHULTZ (GERMAN) Yes you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who? Dr.SCHULTZ (GERMAN) I can't tell you. Our mutual friend has a flair for the dramatic, and he wants to surprise you. !!0
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he? He points at the adjoining door. Dr.SCHULTZ (GERMAN) Standing right behind that door. Her head moves in the direction of the door. He looks to the young woman; Dr.SCHULTZ (GERMAN) Promise me you won't scream? She nods her head, yes. Dr.SCHULTZ (GERMAN) Say, I promise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I promise. Dr.Schultz moves to the door, and lightly raps on it. The door knob turns. The door slowly opens revealing... Her husband Django, but different, all cowboyed out and cleaned up. He smiles at her, and says;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Little Trouble Maker. Obviously a pet name between them. Broomhilda goes into a bit of shock... .first she loses strength in her wrist, so the glass tips over, and the water spills on the floor ... .followed quickly by herself spilling on the floor in a dead. faint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The two men look at the woman on the floor, then at each other; Dr.SCHULTZ You silver tongued devil you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to later, as we see Dr.Schultz and Django explain what- they're doing there, who they're pretending to be, and what their plan is to Broomhilda. We hear a woman whistle a soft pretty tune on the soundtrack. It's not a happy tune.. .per se. But it's pretty, and vaguely optimistic ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SLAVE PEN The doomed men who didn't sell at Greenville, brooding Rodney and Chester and Chicken Charly, spend their last night at Candyland sleeping under the stars in The Slave Pen. The same whistling tune continues over this scene. Rodney sees, The whole slave selling and buying group, Django, Dr.Schultz, Candie, Bartholomew, Moguy, Ace Woody, Brown and Cody, and the Overseers, walk across the plantation grounds on their way to The Arena. Laughin' and joshin' all the way. The hatred Rodney feels for that group of men burns inside him like a red hot poker. A study in powerless fury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the dining room of The Big House with its knives, spoons and forks. She's all by herself as she goes through this duty. The whistling tune we've been listening to has been coming from Broomhilda whistling as she sets the table. Suddenly out of the darkness of the background appears Stephen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What you. whistlin', girl? Broomhilda stops whistling and spins surprised in Stephen's direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What was you whistlin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh nuttin'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You weren't whistlin' nothin', you were whistlin' somethin'. What'cha whistlin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno. Somethin' I heard. I don't know no.name. )/Z
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's kinder pretty. She doesn't say anything in return.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a compliment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you. Stephen steps out of the shadows into the light closer to Broomhilda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm just sayin', two days ago you wus' in such misery here, you hadda run off. So you run off, we catch your ass an' drag you back. Then we stick your bare ass to sizzle in The Hot Box for' 'bout ten hours. Now here you are two days later, whistlin' while you work. I'm just sayin', I.wouldn' think you'd have a hellva lot to whistle 'bout. .I'm jus' sayin'. He watches the effect his words have on Broomhilda's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm done here, may I be excused?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you may. She moves off to another part of the house. He watches her shuffle off.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DISSOLVE TO BROOMHILDA SETTING THE DINNER TABLE

direction.raw_text: - DINING ROOM (BIG HOUSE) - NIGHT Later that evening, Django and a lot of other white people (Calvin Candie, Lara Lee, Moguy, and Dr.Schultz) sat around the dinner table. They are being served by the black people we've come to know at Candyland (Stephen, Cora, and because Dr.Schultz likes her Broomhilda). Along with an army of DOMESTIC SLAVES acting as wait service. Knowing Django's a slaver, and for his dinner table privileges, the Domestic Slaves despise Django. Even Broomhilda will be shocked to hear him speak like a slaver, even though they obviously gave her a heads up on their masquerade. We pick up the conversation in mid-negotiation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Dr.SCHULTZ Look Monsieur Candle, they were all fine specimens, no doubt about it. But the best three, by far, were Sampson, Goldie, and Eskimo Joe. - By the way, why's he called Eskimo Joe?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh you never know how these nigger nicknames get started. His name was Joe-...maybe one day he said he was cold.. .who knows? Dr.SCHULTZ Irregardless, we all know Samson's your best, and you'll never sell him and I can see why, he's a champion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All three are champions. Django contradicts, as he chews his steak;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Samson's the champion. The other two are pretty good. All the Domestic Slaves around the table STIFFEN at witnessing Django contradict Calvin Candie. Including Broomhilda, who's wielding the Gravy Boat. After Django says that, while in shock, she over pours beef gravy on Lara Lee's mashed potatoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hildi! Broomhilda snaps back. Instead of getting angry, Candle seems to reflect on that analysis, then issues his own appraisal;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can Eskimo Joe whip Sampson, no. Can he take Goldie, probably not - Goldie's the best dirty fightin' nigger I ever saw. But as long as you don't put 'em up against those two., Eskimo Joe will whip any niggers ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe. The Domestics FREEZE for a jerky second when Django says that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr.SCHULTZ You must understand, Monsieur Candie, while admittedly a .neophyte in the nigger fight game, I do have a bit of a background in the European traveling circus. Hence, I have big ideas when it comes to presentation. I need something more then just a big nigger. He needs to have panache. A sense of showmanship. I want to be able to . bill. him as. The Black Hercules. I said., and I quote; "I would pay top dollar for the, right nigger." Now I'm not saying Eskimo Joe is the wrong nigger - per se ... but is he right as rain ... ? Everyone waits for Calvin's response. He milks the moment by taking a sip of his mint julep, then says;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr.Schultz, i will have you know, there is no one in the nigger fight game that appreciates the value of showmanship more then, Monsieur Calvin J. Candie. But one must not forget the most important thing in the nigger fight game. (BEAT) A nigger that can win fights. That should be your first, second, third, four, and fifth concern. After you have that, and you know you have that, then, you can start to implement a grande design. But since I enjoy oldest man 'at the table status - beating Moguy by one year for that honor allow the old sage to advise, first things first. Broomhilda comes around with a bowl of string green beans. Dr.Schultz says something pleasant to her in German.. She smiles, and says something pleasant back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I see you two gettin' on? Dr.Schultz breaks into a wide grin; Dr.SCHULTZ .Famously. (DRAMATIC PAUSE) Monsieur Candie, you can't imagine what it's like not to hear you native tongue for four years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hell, I can't imagine two weeks in Boston.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everybody at the table chuckles. Dr.SCHULTZ I can't express the joy I felt conversing in my mother tongue. And Broomhilda is a charming conversation companion. As Broomhilda holds the bowl of green beans for Moguy, Lara Lee notices how Django and Broomhilda look and try not to look at each other. Stephen enters the room with a fresh mint julep for Monsieur Candie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know doctor, you can lay on all the German sweet talk you want, but it looks like this ponys got big eyes for Django. Lara Lee has no idea how right she is, but when she said it, all three, Django, Broomhilda, and Schultz, involuntarily jerk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... .STEPHEN sees it. Schultz covers the jerk with more of his verbal gobbilty gook. Except for Stephen, no one else was the wiser. Broomhilda takes her greenbeans and leaves the dining room for the kitchen. Stephen watches her go, then looks at Django, then hands Candie his mint julep, and goes into a broad routine for the table's benefit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen, you're amazing. I haven't finished a drink in this house in twenty years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When a man likes a cold drink, a man likes a COLD drink. Chuckle... . chuckle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you overhear that joke I said about me spending two weeks in Boston
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have any idea the work I do to see food gets on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What does that hafta do with the price of Tea in China?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think when I'm in that kitchen, I got nothin' better to do then listen in here to you tellin' unfunny jokes? Chuckle... . chuckle...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? They laughed!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course they laughed, their parents raised them right. When they're a guest in somebody's house, and the master of of the house thinks he's- funny, you suppose to laugh. They'd be rude not to. Chuckle... .chuckle... They play their little comedy routine for all it's worth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No it was really funny, (TO TABLE) wasn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what do you expect these people to say? What you need to do is stop embarrassing your guest. (TO TABLE) Everybody don't laugh at him, you're being polite, I understand, you mean well, but it just encourages him. Chuckle-chuckle... As the white folks chuckle, Stephen moves back into the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KITCHEN (BIG HOUSE) - NIGHT Once Stephen enters the kitchen, his smile melts away, and he locks eyes on Broomhilda. He moves over to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know that nigger? /i12 She spins around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't stall me bitch, you know who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the table? I don't know him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . You don't know him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't lie to me now, would you? She shakes her head, no. Stephen looks at her skeptical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, if you say so.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pick it up again in mid-negotiation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eskimo Joe's a quality nigger, no doubt about it. But if it was my money, I wouldn't pay twelve thousand dollars for him. Dr.SCHULTZ What would your price be?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if I ,was inclined to be generous,. and I don't know why I would be inclined to be generous... . nine thousand ... . maybe. Candie's lawyer chimes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the real question is, not how much he cost, but how much he can earn? Dr.SCHULTZ Django?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a years time, seven or eight fights - outside of Mississippi - where his Candyland pedigree weren't well known - Virginia... (CON'T)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georgia -- all goes well ...twenty to twenty one thousand dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Precisely Bright Boy, good on ya. Any way you cut that cake, that spells profit. Not to, mention a years worth of action at the big table in a blood sport with a winner nigger. However let me reclarify how this whole negotiation came about. It wasn't me who came to you to sell a nigger, it was you who approached me to buy one. Now that nine thousand dollar figure Bright Boy was banding about, ain't too far off from right. And if I wanted to sell Eskimo Joe for that, I could sell 'em any day of the week. But like you said in Greenville doctor, I don't wanna sell 'em. It was only your ridiculous offer of twelve thousand dollars that would make me consider it. Dr.Schultz considers'Calvin Candie's words, then suddenly says; Dr.SCHULTZ You know Monsieur Candie... . you do possess the power of persuasion. Candie smiles at that remark. Then SUDDENLY Schultz SLAPS the table hard with his hand, and says; Dr.SCHULTZ Why not! Monsieur Candie, you have a deal, Eskimo Joe, twelve thousand dollars! The White people at the table get very happy. Dr.Schultz continues; Dr.SCHULTZ However, that is a tremendous amount of money. And the way you have your Mr.Moguy, I have a lawyer, a persnickety man named Tuttle. And I would need my man to draw up a legal contract before I would feel comfortable exchanging that amount of money for flesh. Not to mention having Eskimo Joe examined by a physician of my choosing. So say I return in about five days time with my Mr.Tuttle. And then my Mr.Tuttle and your Mr.Moguy can hash out the finer points between themselves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Splendid. (CALLING TO THE KITCHEN) Stephen, time for dessert! Stephen, Cora, Broomhilda, and the other Domestics come out of the kitchen to clear away the dirty dishes. Broomhilda goes to Calvin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I take away your dishes, Monsieur Candle?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you may, Hildi. She begins gathering the dirty dishes. Candie looks up at her as she works.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So Hildi, how you like servin at the big table in the big house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like it a lot Monsieur Candle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a lot better then sizzling in that hot box, or draggin' your ass through a bramble bush, ain't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes 'em. With Candie interrogating Broomhilda, Django tenses up. Stephen clocks this. Stephen decides to test Django's reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know Monsieur Candle, the doctor might be interested in seein' Hildi's "peeled" back. Seein' as he don't see many niggers where he from.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When you was alone with Hildi here, didja just speak German, or did ya git her clothes off? !20 Dr.SCHULTZ We just spoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you haven't seen her back? Dr.SCHULTZ No I haven't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then Stephen's right, you would probably find this interesting. Hildi, take off your dress, and show us your back. Django hears this. Broomhilda instinctively shoots a look to Django. Stephen clocks it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin, I just got her all dressed up and looking nice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Lara Lee, Dr.Schultz is from Dusseldorf, they don't got niggers there. And he's a man of medicine. I'm sure it would fascinate him, the niggers endurance for pain. I mean Hildi got something like fifteen lashes on her back. Lara Lee get one, she'd lose her mind. These niggers are tough, no doubt about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calvin, we are eating - dessert, no less. Ain't no one wanna see her whipped up back. Django continues to watching this play out. Stephen watches him. Candie folds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay okay Lara. Maybe after dinner. During the brandies. Broomhilda - dismissed - takes Calvin's dishes and heads back into the kitchen. Stephen takes one more look at Django, and follows Broomhilda behind the kitchen door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - KITCHEN (BIG HOUSE) - NIGHT In the kitchen with the OTHER DOMESTICS, Stephen says to Broomhilda;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought you said you didn't know him? Broomhilda turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? Stephen approaches her, the other Domestics get quiet and watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said, you said, you didn't know him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mister Stephen, I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you lyin to me? As tears begin to well in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I ain't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why you cryin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're scarin' me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why am I scarin' you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're scary. Things have become so tense and quiet in the kitchen, that the dinner table conversation begins to bleed inside. We hear Dr.Schultz in the next room say; Dr.SCHULTZ (OS) .to speak German,with Hildi this afternoon was positively soul enriching. Stephen hears this, he's starting to get the idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes to to Broomhilda.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, stay in the kitchen. Stephen moves to the kitchen door, swings it open, and watches Dr.Schultz prepare to proposition Candie for Broomhilda. Stephen knows these two jokers (Django and Schultz) are up to something, and now he's just figured it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DINNER TABLE (BIG HOUSE) - NIGHT Dr.SCHULTZ You indicated earlier you would be willing to part with Hildi?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes siree bob I did. Dr.SCHULTZ Well in that case allow me to propose another proposition? In full "Ole Jimmie" performance, Stephen BARGES in the room,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr.Schultz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Monsieur Candie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen, you just interrupted Dr.Schultz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Dr.Schultz) Oh, I do apologize, doctor. My hearin' ain't worth a damn these days. (TO CANDIE) Monsieur Candie, I need a word with you in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, you mean get outta my chair?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you could manage it. It's about dessert.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about dessert?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would rather tell you in private.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're having rhubarb pie, what sort of melodrama could be brewing back there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen bends down and whispers in his ear;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Meet me in the library. Well that's a horse of a different color. That means whatever Stephen has to say, hasn't anything to do with rhubarb pie. "Meet me in the library" is their secret signal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine friend Stephen, I'll be along momentarily. Stephen exits. Candie stands up from his chair and addresses the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well as you can see, talented no doubt as they are in the kitchen, from time to time, adult supervision is required. If you'll excuse me a moment. Candie exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - LIBRARY (BIG HOUSE) - NIGHT A masculine sanctuary for Calvin Candie. Walls of perfectly bound books. Stuffed animal heads (deer, boar) that he's shot, sit mounted on the walls. There's comfy red leather chairs and a bar in the globe. When WE CUT TO this room, we cut to Stephen sitting in one of the red leather chairs, drinking a brandy out of a brandy sifter. Calvin enters the room, sees Stephen sitting in the chair, drinking his brandy, and doesn't bat an eye. It appears, in this room, Calvin's and Stephen's life long friendship exits on a different plane. Outside of outside eyes, in this room, all pretense of master and slave is dropped, and the number one and number two.. men of Candyland can talk turkey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those motherfuckers ain't here to buy no mandingos. They want that girl. -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell you talkin' about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They playin your ass for a fool, that's what I'm talkin' bout. They ain't here for no muscle bound Jimmie, they here for that girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What girl, Hildi?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, Hildi. The niggers know each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He just bought Eskimo Joe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did he give you any money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well not yet, but -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - Then he didn't R ..Y diddly, not yet no how. But he was just about to buy, who he came here to buy, when I interrupted him. Thank you Stephen - you're welcome Calvin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you gettin' all this? Why would they go through all that trouble, to. buy a nigger with a chewed up back, ain't worth five hundred dollars?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well they're doin' it cause Django's in love with Hildi. She's probably his wife. Now why that German gives a fuck about who that uppity son-of-a--bitch is in love with, I'm sure I don't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If she's who they want, why the whole snake oil pitch about mandingos?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you wouldn't pay no never mind to four hundred dollar. But twelve thousand got you real friendly. Calvin thinks ... .as per usual, Stephen's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those lyin' goddamn.time wastin' sonsabitches! (LOUDER) Sonsabitches! You just watch, I'm gonna fix their wagon but good! Stephen, we .gonna have us a Candyland tar and feathering!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now Calvin.. .not that I wouldn't enjoy seein' something like that ... . but why don't you sit down and let's talk about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I let a goddamn nigger and nigger lovin' huckster insinuate themselves at my dinner table, and play this whole goddamn plantation for a fool!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Calm-the-fuck-down, sit down, and let's discuss this. A frustrated Calvin finally collapses in the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now look, you knew, and I knew, there was something up with these two. We just didn't know what. But now we do. They don't want you to know how bad they want that girl. But these ole boys have rode a lotta miles, went t6 a whole lotta trouble, and done spread a whole lotta bull to get this girl. They must want her mighty bad. Way I see it, ain't nothin' changed. They wanna buy a nigger, you wanna sell a nigger.The only thing done changed is the advantage. (BEAT) Now we got it. .So let's go back in there and busts these motherfucker's chops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DINING ROOM (BIG HOUSE) - NIGHT The Dinner Table Guests listen to Lara Lee'Candie-Fitzwilly hold court melodramatically ... . Till ... . Calvin Candie enters the room from the kitchen door. Lara Lee, oblivious to her brothers change in demeanor, blurts out upon
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There you are! I was beginning to think you and that of crow ran off together. Schultz and Django feel the change in their host's demeanor, as he stares down the table at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That'd be a hellva note, wouldn't it Lara Lee? (CON'T)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lara Lee, I just looked out the big winda. Ace Woody's out there dealin' with some shady slaver sellin' a passel of Ponys. Would you be a dear and go out there and give them gals an eyeball. That of boy knows everything to know 'bout mandingos, But he don't know diddly 'bout black puddin'. Lara Lee excuses herself and leaves the room, as she goes out, Bartholomew, with his Sawed Off Shotgun, comes.in behind Schultz and Django.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I ask you two gentlemen to look over your shoulder? Schultz and Django do, and see Bartholomew with his sawed off shotgun pointing at them. Calvin Candie removes his arm from behind his back, and in his hand he's holding a big ugly hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now lay your palms flat on the table top. They put their palms on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you lift those palms off that turtle shell table top, Bartholomew gonna let loose with both barrels of that sawed off. There's been a lotta lies said around this table tonight-but that.. .you can believe. (BEAT) Mr.Moguy, would you be so kind as to collect the pistols hangin' on those boys'hips? Mr.Moguy does. Holding the hammer in his hand, Candie continues to hold court.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now where were we? Oh yes, I do believe you were just getting ready to make me a proposition to buy Broomhilda. Right? Dr.SCHULTZ Right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stephen! Bring out Hildi! Ix? Stephen enters the dining room through the kitchen door, holding roughly in his grip, Broomhilda. He holds a small Derringer pistol against the side of her head. Django and Schultz react.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now it should be quite clear by now I know you're not here to buy no mandingos. Reason y'all came to Candyland, is y'all want Broomhilda. But y'all don't want me to know how much you want 'er. So instead, you waste my time with all this Eskimo Joe horseshit. (TO STEPHEN) Stephen, put her in that chair. Stephen sits the young lady down in Moguy's old chair. With their palms against the table, unarmed, Django and Schultz silently watch Candie's next move. Candie, still holding the hammer, continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now the way I see it, ain't nothin' changed.. You still wanna buy a nigger, I still wanna sell one. So, with that in mind, in Greenville, Dr.Schultz, you yourself said, "For the Right Nigger you'd be willing to pay what some would consider a ridiculous amount." To which, me myself said, "What is your definition of ridiculous?" To which you said, "Twelve thousand dollars." Now considering you two have ridden a whole lotta miles, went to a whole lotta trouble, and done spread a whole lotta bull, to purchase the lovely lady to my left, it would appear that Broomhilda is, "The Right Nigger." And if y'all wanna leave Candyland with Broomhilda, the price is twelve thousand dollars. Dr.SCHULTZ I take it you prefer the take it or leave it style of negotiating. Candie continuing to hold the hammer continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Under the laws of Chickasaw County, Broomhilda is my property. And I can do anything with my property I so desire. He brings the big hammer down hard on the dinner table, making everybody jump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And if you think my price for this nigger is too steep, what I'm gonna desire to do is, take this hammer and beat her ass to death with it. Right in front of both y'all. He SMASHES the arm rest of the chair Broomhilda's sitting in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put up or shut up, Schultz. You wanna save this nigger bitch, you gonna pay my price. Dr.SCHULTZ May I lift my hands from the table top in order to remove my billfold?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you may. Dr.Schultz removes his long brown leather billfold from his gray suit jacket, and says;, Dr.SCHULTZ Easy come, easy go. He slides the billfold down the table to Candie. The plantation owner takes out the money, does a quick count, then looks down the table at the seated Schultz, and says;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pleasure doin' business with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DINING ROOM (BIG HOUSE) - NIGHT INSERT: Calvin signing over Broomhilda's BILL OF SALE. .Moguy signs as a witness. Broomhilda stands next to Django, and watches her Master sign her freedom papers. Dr.Schultz sits off by himself. He's very disturbed. All the white people with Calvin Candie are happy and celebrate Candie's successes with glasses of Brandy. Lara Lee, Ace Woody, and Brown and Cody have joined the' celebration. For an experienced horsetrader, the just concluded transaction is a thing of legend. He just sold a Pony, with a tore up back, and a runaway "r" burned in her cheek - ain't worth five hundred dollars- for twelve thousand. Stephen smiles and laughs it up with everybody else. The Other domestics bring out little plates of rhubarb pie, and buzz around pouring coffee for the white people. Candie walks over to the seated Schultz, he carries a small plate of rhubarb pie with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rhubarb pie? Schultz looks at the pie and the man. Dr.SCHULTZ No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you brooding 'bout me getting the best of ya? Dr.SCHULTZ Actually, I was thinking of that poor devil you fed to the dogs today, D'Artagnan. And I was wondering what Dumas would make of all this. Calvin hands the doctor the two pieces of paper he needs. Broomhilda's bill of sale, and her freedom papers. As he says the following he examines he papers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dumas...? Dr.SCHULTZ Alexander Dumas. He wrote "The Three Musketeers." I figured you must be an admirer. You named your slave after that novel's lead character. If Alexander Dumas had been there today, I wonder what he would of made of it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You doubt he'd approve? Dr.SCHULTZ Yes his approval would be a dubious proposition at best.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Soft hearted Frenchy? Dr.SCHULTZ Alexander Dumas is black.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Schultz rises, puts the papers in his back pocket, .looks to his two companions, Django and Broomhilda, and says; Dr.SCHULTZ We got it, let's go. (TO CANDIE) Normally Monsieur Candie, I would say, auf wiedersehen. But since what auf wiedersehen actually means is, till I see you again, and since I never wish to see you again, to you sir, I say, goodbye. Schultz begins to cross the room towards the exit. When Calvin says to the German's back;
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more moment, Doc! Dr.SCHULTZ What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a custom here in the South, once a business deal is concluded, for the two parties to shake hands. It implies good faith. Dr.SCHULTZ I'm not from the South. He turns to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in my house, doctor, I'm afraid I must insist. This turns Schultz around. Dr.SCHULTZ Insist what...? That I shake your hand before I leave? Then I'm afraid I must insist in the opposite direction. Calvin walks closer to the German doctor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I think you are? Dr.SCHULTZ What you think I am? No I don't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think you are a bad loser. Dr.SCHULTZ And I think you're an abysmal winner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never the less, here in Chickasaw County a deal ain't done till the two parties have shook hands. Even after all this paper signin', don't mean shit you don't shake my hand. Dr.SCHULTZ If I don't shake your hand, you're gonna throw away twelve thousand dollars...? I don't think so. Schultz looks to Django and Broomhilda. Dr.SCHULTZ Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bartholomew, if she tries to leave here before this German shakes my hand. Cut 'er down. Schultz looks to Django... . then to Candle.. .and then with a smile on his face, and a twinkle in his eye, asks
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr.SCHULTZ. You really want me to shake your hand? Django gets it.
direction.name: direction
